parameters.name: AlertConfig.EndTime
parameters.description:
The end of the time range during which the alert rule is effective. Valid values: 0 to 23.

For example, if the `AlertConfig.StartTime` parameter is set to 0 and the `AlertConfig.EndTime` parameter is set to 22, the alert rule is effective from 00:00:00 to 22:00:00.

> Alert notifications are sent based on the specified threshold only if the alert rule is effective.

parameters.name: AlertConfig.NotifyType
parameters.description:
The alert notification methods. Valid values:

0: Alert notifications are sent by using emails and DingTalk chatbots.

parameters.name: AlertConfig.SilenceTime
parameters.description: The mute period during which new alerts are not sent even if the trigger conditions are met. Unit: seconds. Default value: 86400. The default value indicates one day.

parameters.name: AlertConfig.StartTime
parameters.description:
The beginning of the time range during which the alert rule is effective. Valid values: 0 to 23.

For example, if the `AlertConfig.StartTime` parameter is set to 0 and the `AlertConfig.EndTime` parameter is set to 22, the alert rule is effective from 00:00:00 to 22:00:00.

> Alert notifications are sent based on the specified threshold only if the alert rule is effective.

parameters.name: AlertConfig.WebHook
parameters.description: The callback URL.

parameters.name: AlertConfigEscalationList
parameters.description: None

parameters.name: AlertConfigTargetList
parameters.description: The resources for which alerts are triggered.

parameters.name: GroupId
parameters.description: The ID of the application group.

parameters.name: InstanceList
parameters.description:
The ECS instances that are monitored. Valid values of N: 1 to 21.

> This parameter must be specified when `TaskScope` is set to `GROUP_SPEC_INSTANCE`.

parameters.name: TaskName
parameters.description: The name of the availability monitoring task. The name must be 4 to 100 characters in length, and can contain letters, digits, and underscores (\_).

parameters.name: TaskOption.HttpHeader
parameters.description:
The header of the HTTP request. Format: `Parameter name:Parameter value`. Separate multiple parameters with carriage return characters. Example:

    params1:value1
    params2:value2

parameters.name: TaskOption.HttpMethod
parameters.description:
The HTTP request method. Valid values:

*   GET
*   POST
*   HEAD

> This parameter must be specified when TaskType is set to HTTP.

parameters.name: TaskOption.HttpNegative
parameters.description:
The method to trigger an alert. The alert can be triggered based on whether the specified alert rule is included in the response body. Valid values:

*   true: If the HTTP response body includes the alert rule, an alert is triggered.
*   false: If the HTTP response does not include the alert rule, an alert is triggered.

> This parameter must be specified when TaskType is set to HTTP.

parameters.name: TaskOption.HttpPostContent
parameters.description: The content of the HTTP POST request.

parameters.name: TaskOption.HttpResponseCharset
parameters.description:
The character set that is used in the HTTP response.

> Only UTF-8 is supported.

parameters.name: TaskOption.HttpResponseMatchContent
parameters.description: The response to the HTTP request.

parameters.name: TaskOption.HttpURI
parameters.description: The URI that you want to monitor. This parameter is required if the TaskType parameter is set to HTTP or Telnet.

parameters.name: TaskOption.Interval
parameters.description:
The interval at which detection requests are sent. Unit: seconds. Valid values: 15, 30, 60, 120, 300, 900, 1800, and 3600.

> This parameter is available only for the CloudMonitor agent V3.5.1 or later.

parameters.name: TaskOption.TelnetOrPingHost
parameters.description:
The domain name or IP address that you want to monitor.

>  This parameter is required if the TaskType parameter is set to PING.

parameters.name: TaskScope
parameters.description:
The range of instances that are monitored by the availability monitoring task. Valid values:

*   GROUP: All ECS instances in the application group are monitored.
*   GROUP_SPEC_INSTANCE: Specified ECS instances in the application group are monitored. The TaskScope parameter must be used in combination with the InstanceList parameter. The InstanceList parameter specifies the ECS instances to be monitored.

parameters.name: TaskType
parameters.description:
The monitoring type of the availability monitoring task. Valid values:

*   PING
*   TELNET
*   HTTP
